thread.title: UVM wraps ESPN Events Invitational with win over Princeton
thread.title_full: UVM wraps ESPN Events Invitational with win over Princeton

author: Jack Fitzsimmons
title: UVM wraps ESPN Events Invitational with win over Princeton
text:
KISSIMMEE, Fla. (WCAX) - The UVM men’s basketball team weathered a major comeback from Princeton to close the ESPN Events Invitational with a 79-74 win.
Vermont started red hot and led 43-30 with just over three minutes to play in the first half, but a 27-4 extended run spanning halftime would put Princeton in the driver’s seat as the two teams headed down the stretch.
Trailing by three in the closing minutes, Gus Yalden hit a three to tie the game and added another bucket to finish with 27 points before Noah Barnett slammed the door with a breakaway dunk at the horn.
“I think we just stuck together as a team,” Yalden said after the game. “One thing that I’ve learned from these guys is that we’re never out of it. Knowing this Vermont team has won some games where they just weren’t supposed to win. And I felt like that was kind of the night. You find a way to gut it out and just get that dub. And that’s what we did tonight. I’m learning from some great guys and a great team, great coaches, just a great program.”
On Tuesday, Rice grad Drew Bessette hit the halfcourt shot to end morning shootaround, so we caught up with the local kid.
On Tuesday, Rice grad Drew Bessette hit the halfcourt shot to end morning shootaround, so we caught up with the local kid. The Cats also had the support of friends, family, and fans from all over on their trip.
The Cats also had the support of friends, family, and fans from all over on their trip. Vermont will return home to face Yale at 2 p.m. on Sunday afternoon.
